arts.ttl: Slavia Prague 0-3 Arsenal ANALYSIS: Why Mikel Merino proves again to be more than a makeshift striker, the unsung player set to play an important role for the Gunners and how Mikel Arteta's side keep making history
arts.sum: ISAAN KHAN AT FORTUNA ARENA: Arsenal's stellar start to the season continued on Tuesday night with a 3-0 win at Slavia Prague in the Champions League.

arts.sum: At 15 years and 308 days, Dowman became the youngest player to appear in Europeâ€™s premier competition

arts.ttl: Arsenal make it 10 wins in a row as they cruise past Slavia Prague with Merino double
arts.sum: Another game, another slew of records for Arsenalâ€™s defensive machine. This time it was one that had stretched back more than 55 years, when Leeds became the last English team not to concede a goal in their opening four matches, in the 1969/70 European Cup campaign under Don Revie. Slavia Prague gave it their best shot and thought they had been awarded a late penalty, only for the video assistant referee to deny them. The Czech champions finally recorded a shot on target against David Raya in stoppage time, but Arsenal made it eight successive clean sheets in all competitions for the first time since they were in what was the Second Division, in 1903. arts.ttl: Merino masterclass, 122-year-old record equalled as Arsenal slay Slavia Prague
arts.sum: Arsenal equal an astonishing 122-year-old clean sheet record and Mikel Merino produced an attacking masterclass in a 3-0 Champions League league-phase victory away to Slavia Prague.

arts.ttl: Striker Merinoâ€™s double sees Arsenal past Slavia Prague
arts.sum: Mikel Merino showed his makeshift striker skills once again in place of the injured Viktor Gyokeres as his double sent Arsenal top of the Champions League via a 3-0 win over Slavia Prague.
